learning_outcomes.description: Knowledge of field - Identify and scope a professional or research area of inquiry, and develop related questions, in a critical area of sustainable energy.

Knowledge of field - Locate and evaluate relevant literature and prior art; locate, access, select and use technical and commercial information from various sources; relate prior knowledge to the problem to identify how it can best be applied to tackle the problem.
Knowledge of field - Conceptualise, develop and implement a methodology to produce results for the Project, delivered to academic and professional standards.
Analysis and critical thinking - Collect and analyse data; elicit project requirements and academic concepts.
Analysis and critical thinking - Draw conclusions based on evidence and argument in a field of sustainable energy.
Analysis and critical thinking - Contextualise outputs relevant to current research and industry practice.
Communication - Build professional links and networks with energy practitioners as part of the Project experience.
Communication - Produce a written report or other instrument that eloquently communicates integrated, reflective approaches to the sustainable energy challenge.
Communication - Deliver an oral presentation at a professional level (similar to an international conference or 'board of directors' briefing).
Communication - Confidentially discuss relevant aspects of the Project, and why it matters in the context of the sustainable energy transition, to relevant stakeholders.

assessments.task_description:
Please consult the Professional Project Handbook for full details of this assessment task. The Handbook is available from ENGY Integrated Resources on Blackboard, or by emailing the Course Coordinator.

In cases where proposals fail to meet the required standards (as outlined in the Professional Projects Handbook), students will be allowed a week in which to revise the proposal document in response to feedback but with their mark capped at 50%.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Project Proposals are to be submitted via the link on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Please consult the Professional Project Handbook for full details of this assessment task. The Handbook is available from ENGY Integrated Resources on Blackboard, or by emailing the Course Coordinator.

The interim report submission is necessary for the student to demonstrate:

  • written progress toward the final project output; and
  • effective writing skills for the purpose of communicating reflection and understanding of integrated approaches to energy management principles, theory and concepts.

In cases where Interim Reports fail to meet the required standards (as outlined in the Professional Projects Handbook), students will be allowed a week in which to revise the document in response to feedback but with their mark capped at 50%.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Interim Reports are to be submitted via the link on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Research and report writing

Activities vary according to project scope and delivery mode, and may include field work, industry placements, interviews and surveys, desktop modelling and analysis, software design, and thesis writing.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07, L08, L09
learning_activities.topic_description: Research and report writing Activities vary according to project scope and delivery mode, and may include field work, industry placements, interviews and surveys, desktop modelling and analysis, software design, and thesis writing.

learning_activities.topic:
Presentation session

Students will present their Professional Project at a Presentation 'conference' session (schedule TBA). Students are expected to attend the entire session to support their peers, which may also include students undertaking MSE Mini Projects.

Learning outcomes: L09, L10
learning_activities.topic_description: Presentation session Students will present their Professional Project at a Presentation 'conference' session (schedule TBA). Students are expected to attend the entire session to support their peers, which may also include students undertaking MSE Mini Projects.
